text: Hi Halima - I'm so pleased you've worked things out. It sounds really sensible doing mock exams. You can assess the work load and see how realistic it all is. Good shout!

Gap years are a bit scary and you don't want to waste them. I didn't do a gap year because I knew I had a year out including within my degree, which is when I went to Paris. I think if you know you're going to have a year in industry, or a year doing something that's already included in your degree, then a gap year isn't the be all and end all.
Although I have friends who did gap years and got some really good work experience! I suppose there's no rush with anything!
More of my friends took a year out after uni than before.

Ah good question! What was the most exciting thing last week? Well, I work on one of our social investment funds, and we approved a new social business called Nemi Teas. They employ refugees to help package and seel their own tea brand - they're really cool and you should look them up! We've agreed to invest in them to help them grow their operations. I'll be working with them to help in a more practical way. That was a great highlight of the week.

This week, I have our annual 'staff festival'. The whole of UnLtd are going up to the Peak District to discuss the organisation  as a whole and our vision for the next year. It's going to be great because we have a really good purpose and we help amazing social business grow and reach more people. I love the company i work for because the vision is really clear- and everyone is SO nice.
